com.complexible.common.util.concurrent

Class ParallelTaskExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.complexible.common.util.concurrent.ParallelTaskExecutor

  • public final class ParallelTaskExecutor
extends Object

    Simple wrapper around an ExecutorService which will ensure that all the tasks run are run with the same thread factory.

    Since:
    0.4.7

    • Method Detail

      • submit

        public <T> Future<T> submit(Callable<T> theCallable)

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
               throws InterruptedException,
                      ExecutionException
        Checks if all the submitted tasks are done and returns true if there is no running task. If an error was thrown during the execution of any submitted task, it will be thrown.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        ExecutionException

      • waitUntilComplete

        public void waitUntilComplete()
                       throws ExecutionException,
                              InterruptedException
        Waits until the completion of all submitted tasks and throws an exception if an execution or interrupted exception occurred during the execution of any submitted task. The exception thrown here will be exactly the same one as if Future.get() function has been called. Thus, if this exception has already been handled externally it can be ignored here. There may be multiple exceptions that occurred during the execution of tasks but this function will throw only the first exception ignored.
        Throws:
        ExecutionException
        InterruptedException

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shut down the executor and clean up its resources
